thread.title: Gary Barlow denies claims Let It Shine is rigged after revelation Jason Brock is ALREADY a star
thread.title_full: Gary Barlow denies claims Let It Shine is rigged after revelation Jason Brock is ALREADY a star

author: Danny Walker
title: Gary Barlow denies claims Let It Shine is rigged after revelation Jason Brock is ALREADY a star
text:
Gary Barlow denies claims Let It Shine is rigged after revelation Jason Brock is ALREADY a star The Take That singer-songwriter has hit back at recent claims Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Jason Brock wows judges with Whitney hit Share this video Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
It got off to an impressive start when it launched to impressive ratings, last week. 
But Gary Barlow's new talent show Let It Shine has already been branded a fix - after its revealed one of the programmes key contenders, Jason Brock, is already a West End star. 
But now the Take That singer, 45, has hit back at the allegations, insisting the show must be "open to everybody". Gary Barlow has defended his new talent show after criticism (Photo: Getty) 
Speaking to Digital Spy , he said: "We can’t say, ‘Hey, listen, if you’ve been on a stage before you can’t come in the door’. The great thing about someone like Jason is that he brings with him two years of experience of being in a show. 
“Now if he’s in a band with someone who’s had no experience and they’re 16 years old and they’ve left home for a year, he’s going to be an amazing support mechanism for [them].” 
“That’s where you see how important it is to be in these groups and to have the cross section we’ve had – people who’ve never been on a stage, people who’ve performed for 20 years but never been given an opportunity to people who’ve already been in musicals. It has to be open to everybody, and it’s important it’s open to everybody for that reason.” Jason Brock is already a successful West End star 
Jason, who has appeared in Thriller live, dazzled viewers and got a standing ovation from judges, but his theatre success had not been widely disclosed. 
Naturally, some fans were disgruntled by the news - although only time will tell if it affects the show's popularity in an already-saturated market. 
Also featuring Dannii Minogue, Martin Kemp and musical theatre star Amber Riley, the judges are looking to cast a troupe of young men who'll star in a forthcoming musical about Take That. Line-up: Amber Riley, Gary Barlow, Dannii Minogue, Martin Kemp (Photo: BBC) The judges are looking for the stars of a new West End musical about Take That (Photo: 1) Read More Let It Shine star Gary Barlow strips naked for steamy series opening and viewers are delighted 
Presented by former Great British Bake Off host Mel Giedroyc and comedian Graham Norton, the programme will also welcome celebrity judges including pop veteran Lulu as the hopefuls are put through their paces. 
Meanwhile, ITV's search for a star kicks off with Will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Gavin Rossdale and Jennifer Hudson on the judging panel for this series of The Voice. 
* Let It Shine returns to BBC tonight at 7pm Like us on Facebook
